newsitem.title: USA: Warner-Lambert up on FDA OK, drug sector rallies.
newsitem.headline: Warner-Lambert up on FDA OK, drug sector rallies.

text.p: Warner-Lambert Co shares jumped on Wednesday amid a broader rally by drug stocks and after Warner-Lambert won U.S. Food and Drug Administration approval to market a cholesterol-cutting drug.

Warner shares jumped two to 76-1/4. Warner said the drug Lipitor has been shown to cut elevated LDL-cholestoerol and is the only drug in its class specifically indicated for cutting both elevated LDL-cholesterol and triglycerides in patients with high levels of cholesterol.
A broad surge in stocks of pharmaceutical companies after a bullish earnings forecast by industry leader Merck and Co Inc also benefitted Warner-Lambert.
The Standard & Poor's pharmaceuticals index rose 3.36, or 1.75 percent, to 194.95 after Merck said it expected strong profits in the fourth quarter of 1996 and for all of 1997.
Merck shares rose 1-3/4 to 78 in heavy trading.
Pfizer Inc shares added 1-3/4 to 82-3/8, Johnson & Johnson shares rose 1-1/4 to 49-3/4, and Schering-Plough Corp added 7/8 to 64-7/8.
